alert.note: Alert for Tillamook (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 6:24AM PST until January 07 at 6:15PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington...Oregon... Grays River near Rosburg affecting Wahkiakum County. Nehalem River near Foss affecting Tillamook and Clatsop Counties. Wilson River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. Naselle River near Naselle affecting Pacific and Wahkiakum Counties. Willapa River near Willapa affecting Pacific County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wilson River near Tillamook. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...Above 14.0 feet, widespread lowland and dairy land flooding begins. Sloughs north of the city, mainly Dougherty, begin to overflow. Minor flooding begins in the business district north of Tillamook and along Hwy 101, particularly during high tide. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM PST Thursday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 13.5 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 630 PM PST.
